description:
In the mysterious future, crystalline organisms called Gems inhabit a world that has been destroyed by six meteors. Each Gem is assigned a role in order to fight against the Lunarians, a species who attacks them in order to shatter their bodies and use them as decorations.

Phosphophyllite, also known as Phos, is a young and fragile Gem who dreams of helping their friends in the war effort. Instead, they are told to compile an encyclopedia because of their delicate condition. After begrudgingly embarking on this task, Phos meets Cinnabar, an intelligent gem who has been relegated to patrolling the isolated island at night because of the corrosive poison their body creates. After seeing how unhappy Cinnabar is, Phos decides to find a role that both of the rejected Gems can enjoy. Houseki no Kuni follows Phos' efforts to be useful and protect their fellow Gems.
synonyms: ดินแดนอัญมณี

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

name.native: フォスフォフィライト
イエローダイヤモンド
ウォーターメロントルマリン

node.description:
[Official Website](http://ptpt.x0.to/pp/)

Haruko Ichikawa is the author and artist of [Houseki no Kuni](https://anilist.co/manga/74489/Houseki-no-Kuni/) (宝石の国, "Land of the Lustrous"). She started her career in 2006 with the one-shot Mushi to Uta (虫と歌, Insects and Songs). Between 2007 and 2011, she published six other one-shots in the manga magazine Monthly Afternoon, which were later compiled into two individual books in the [Ichikawa Haruko Sakuhinshuu](https://anilist.co/manga/66013/Ichikawa-Haruko-Sakuhinshuu/) (市川春子作品集, Haruko Ichikawa Works Collection), titled Mushi to Uta and 25-ji no Vacances.

In 2010, she won the Osamu Tezuka Cultural Prize for Mushi to Uta. She has also contributed characters designs to the Pokémon Sun & Moon and Pokémon Sword & Shield video games.

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

**Height:** 147 cm

[Profile (Toho Entertainment)](https://www.toho-ent.co.jp/actor/1127) | [Website](https://www.yu-ri-ka.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/yurika_official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_YURiKA29_) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yurika_(musician)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/YURiKA_(歌手))

Yurika Kobayashi, mononymously known by the stage name YURiKA, is a Japanese musician from Hasuda, Saitama who is signed to Toho Animation Records.

From an early age, she had dreamed of becoming a musician. She started playing the piano at the age of 3, and she also listened to the music of [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/) and its subgroup Minimoni. While in elementary school, she heard the song "Genesis of Aquarion" by [Akino](https://anilist.co/staff/109335/) in a commercial, which led her to become interested in anime music and a desire to perform songs for anime. Her desire to become an anime musician was also influenced by the popularity of the series [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/) and [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680/KON/) at the time.

In high school, she tried out for the Animax Anison Grand Prix and other anime-related singing competitions. In 2014, she placed 6th in a televised competition sponsored by Nippon TV and first in an anime music singing competition sponsored by NHK. In 2016, she won an audition sponsored by the media company Toho and signed a contract with label Toho Animation Records.

She made her professional debut in 2017 with the release of her first single "Shiny Ray" on February 22, 2017; the title track is used as the first opening theme to the anime television series [Little Witch Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21858/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunoyoko) | [Website](http://kunoyoko.tumblr.com)

A graduate of the Department of Graphic Design at Tama Art University. While still a student, she created installations, sculptures, and animated works centering on themes of young girls, animals, delinquents and other motifs with an undefinable graphic quality.

[Website](http://yuiko-ohara.com/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaDjsWqUnBETKJ2NJqwdUeg/) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ohara_yuiko) 

**Yuiko Oohara** is a Japanese singer and songwriter from Chiba Prefecture who is affiliated with Toho Animation Records. Starting her career as a live performer in 2012, she would also participate in several auditions and competitions. She made her major debut in 2015 with the song "Magic Parade", which was used as the theme song to the short film Little Witch Academia: The Enchanted Parade.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.

__Agency:__ Mausu Promotion (2012-2021), Toho Entertainment (2021-)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TomoyoKurosawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoyo_kurosawa_official_/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosawa-tomoyo/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Kurosawa began studying acting at the age of 3. In 2000, she began appearing in TV dramas, commercials and stage performances. At the age of 13, she made her voice acting debut as [Natsuki Koyama](https://anilist.co/character/30214/) in the 2010 anime film [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/).

Kurosawa became a support member of Sound Horizon in 2008.

On June 8, 2023, her agency announced her marriage on Twitter.

__Awards:__
- Best Lead Actress at the 12th Seiyuu Awards in 2018 for her roles as [Phosphophyllite](https://anilist.co/character/123385/) and [Kumiko Oumae](https://anilist.co/character/88708/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akagi_hisako)

Married to [Arifumi Imai](https://anilist.co/staff/126915/). Representative of [Akagi Production](https://akagipro.jp/).

The founder and CEO of Studio ORANGE. He began as freelance CG creator in the game industry, before switching to anime with 'Zoids: Chaotic Century‘ in 1999. Founded Studio ORANGE in 2004 after working on Shoji Kawamori's 'Aquarion'. He has worked as a 3D/CGI Director and/or Producer for shows from Madhouse, Xebec, Doga Kobo, Kinema Citrus, and Passione.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YohIchi_N) | [Instagram](https://t.co/xeHIbTl8Ut)

Youichi Nishikawa is an art director and background artist. He graduated from Tohoku University of Art and Design and joined Studio Ghibli in 2004. In 2015 he joined the newly established Deho Gallery.
